Package HuffNPuff

Class HuffmanCoding

java.lang.Object
HuffNPuff.HuffmanCoding
public class HuffmanCoding
extends java.lang.Object
HuffmanCoding contains all the necessary methods to encode text using the Huffman Code algorithm
Author:
igtampe

    Displays the results of the Huffman Coding procedure, including the frequency distribution (in non-ascending order) The code linked to each character, The input text, the output (encoded) text, and the amount of space saved by encoding it (assuming 1 bit per character in the output, and 8 bits per character (as per ASCII) in the input).

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Takes the data stored in InputData/StringData.txt and encodes it using Huffman Coding. Then displays relevant data, including:
      • A table displaying Character, Frequency, and Huffman Code
      • The original text
      • The Encoded text
      • The percent of space saved by storing the text as a Huffman-Coded string, assuming 1bit per character in the output, and 8 bits per character in the input.
      Parameters:
      args - The arguements do nothing.

    • LoadData

      public static java.lang.String LoadData​(java.lang.String filename)
      Uses TextFileManager to read and return the first line of the specified file.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file you need the first line of
      Returns:
      The first line of the file you specified, or "" if an IOerror occurred, or if the file was not found.

    • compute_fd

      public static ciic4020.map.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> compute_fd​(java.lang.String OriginalData)
      Comptues the Frequency Distribution of the characters in the string. Uses the MapFD strategy from FreqFinder, though it has been modified to use HashtableSC, instead of the default Java Hashtable.
      Parameters:
      OriginalData - The string you want to compute the frequency distribution of
      Returns:
      A map, where the key is the character, and the data is its frequenecy.

    • huffman_tree

      public static ciic4020.bst.BTNode<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> huffman_tree​(ciic4020.map.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> CharFreq)
      Creates a Huffman Code Tree using the specified character frequency map. The process is as follows:
      1. Take the frequency data and make a sortedlist (Stored by frequency), where each entry is a node that holds its frequency, and it's character (as a string)
      2. Find the 2 least frequent symbols
      3. Create a new node, where the left is the least, and the right is the second least item we previously found. The key of this new node is the sum of the two frequencies, and its value is the two strings put together
      4. Repeat until there is only one symbole left, which will be the root of the tree.
      Parameters:
      CharFreq - A map of character frequency, where each character is mapped to its frequency (as an integer)
      Returns:
      The root node of the tree with Frequency as its key, and the character as its value.

    • huffman_code

      public static ciic4020.map.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> huffman_code​(ciic4020.bst.BTNode<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> Root)
      Uses a Huffman Tree to generate a map with all the characters mapped to their huffman code. This is accomplished recursively using a private, helper function. It goes through the tree in in-order, by checking that the root isn't null, then checking the left node, and then checking the right node.

      The method takes with it a map which holds the codes, and a prefix, which depends on the direction it traveled to reach the node. 0 for left, and 1 for right. When a node is checked, if the string it holds is of length one, it assumes its an end node, and adds it as a huffman code to the map using the prefix, and one more bit to specify the direction it found it. Otherwise, it'll recursively call itself to check the left and right child nodes of the node it found.
      Parameters:
      Root - Root node of the Huffman Tree
      Returns:
      A map with all of the Characters in the tree mapped to their code

    • Encode

      public static java.lang.String Encode​(ciic4020.map.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> Code, java.lang.String Input)
      Takes a Huffman code, and an input string, and returns an huffman-coded text.
      It goes through each character in the string, and builds a return string basing itself on whatever code is linked to the character in the provided code map.
      Parameters:
      Code - The code, where each character is mapped to its respective Huffman code.
      Input - Input string that will be encoded
      Returns:
      The text, but encoded.

    • process_results

      public static void process_results​(ciic4020.map.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> FD, ciic4020.map.Map<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.String> Code, java.lang.String Input, java.lang.String Output)
      Displays the results of the Huffman Coding procedure, including the frequency distribution (in non-ascending order) The code linked to each character, The input text, the output (encoded) text, and the amount of space saved by encoding it (assuming 1 bit per character in the output, and 8 bits per character (as per ASCII) in the input).
      Parameters:
      FD - Frequency distribution map, where each character is mapped to its frequency
      Code - The Huffman Code used to encode the text.
      Input - Input text
      Output - Output (encoded) text.
